results.title: Carnival in France
results.creator_credit: Barry Sloane, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
For two months before Easter the French town of Limoux celebrates the end of winter with the oldest continuous carnival in France. As well as showing preparations for the carnival and the carnival itself the video also visits the neighbouring medieval town of Carcassonne and shows the making of the unique sparkling wine of the area, Blanquette de Limoux.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barry Sloane, Joy Barrow and Barinder Productions

results.title: Carnaval
results.creator_credit: Juan Serrano and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A computer animated story of myth, magic and power and two alien beings spirited away to planet Earth. No dialogue. Original music score by SISMO.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Carnarvon
results.brief_description: Aboriginals of central Queensland left cave paintings and rock engravings in the caves of the Carnarvon ranges. Today the Aboriginals are gone and the true meanings of the many unique designs may never be known.
results.description: Aboriginals of central Queensland left cave paintings and rock engravings in the caves of the Carnarvon ranges. Today the Aboriginals are gone and the true meanings of the many unique designs may never be known.

results.title: Carnal knowledge
results.brief_description: Jules Feiffer’s bittersweet story follows the diverse paths of Jack Nicholson and Art Garfunkel as each tries to match their sexual fantasies with an uncooperative reality. One chooses the narrow confines of the marriage contract, the other the broader pleasures of playing the field. They meet as roommates at college in the 1940s, where Candice Bergen is the object of mutual attention. We meet them again in the 1950s when Garfunkel is a bored suburban husband, and Nicholson is still playing the field, notably with Ann-Margaret. The final 13 minutes of the film are set in the late 1960s.

results.title: Carmen de Sevilla
results.creator_credit: William C. Faure and English Television Drama
results.brief_description: Based on the opera “Carmen” by Georges Bizet and on the original production by the Performing Arts Council of the Transvaal, the Mercedes Molina Spanish Dance Theatre combine flamenco with traditional ballet to present this theatrical performance for television. Features Mercedes Molina as Carmen and Enrique Segovia as Jose.

results.title: Carmen [DeMille]
results.creator_credit: Cecil B. DeMille and David Zucker
results.brief_description: The story that inspired Bizet’s immortal opera is here dramatically recreated with Metropolitan Opera diva Geraldine Farrar as the eponymous, seductive Carmen. Bizet’s score is performed by the London Philharmonic Orchestra. Cast also includes Wallace Reid, Pedro de Cordoba and Horace B Carpenter.

results.title: Carmen
results.creator_credit: Gavin Taylor, Ken Scorfield, Classical Productions and Allied Vision
results.brief_description: The lavish and spectacular television production of Georges Bizet’s “Carmen”, staged at London’s Earls Court in June 1989, proved beyond doubt the resounding success of opera on such a grand scale. Playing to sell-out audiences of over twelve thousand at each performance, the production drew rave reviews from all the critics. Starring Maria Ewing, who has now made this part her own, “Carmen” was staged in the centre of Earls Court, surrounded on all sides by the audience to create the atmosphere of a Spanish bullring.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gavin Taylor, Ken Scorfield, Classical Productions and Allied Vision

results.title: Carmen
results.creator_credit: Carlos Saura, Emiliano Piedra, Television Espanola and Emiliano Productions
results.brief_description: A Spanish flamenco ballet company is trying to create a dance version of “Carmen” out of the Bizet opera, Merimee’s story and flamenco guitar music. Choreographer, Antonio, discovers an unknown girl to play the central role, a woman with a husband in prison. He becomes infatuated with her. But soon the legend of “Carmen” begins to assert itself.

results.title: Carmen
results.creator_credit: Patrice Ledoux, Opera Film Produzione, Production Marel Dassault and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Two of the leading figures in opera today, Placido Domingo and Julia Migenes-Johnson, star in this sumptious and true interpretation of Bizet’s carmen. The ingredients of this romantic opera are a film-maker’s dream: a torrid love story, a tempestuous score, set against a backdrop of glorious Spanish sunshine. Added to this production is the authenticity of Andalusian dance.

results.title: Carmen
results.brief_description: Glyndebourne provides the backdrop for Bizet’s “Carmen”. This new Peter Hall production is a torrid drama of passion, blood and squalor, with sets that capture the earthy warmth of Spain. Maria Ewing sings the title role. Rated: G
